title: Governance and Institutional Design Will Be Critical to Growing a Clean Hydrogen Economy
description: The United States is using new tools to address innovation in clean hydrogen, but success will depend on good governance and broader market development.

title: U.S. Competitiveness Provision: Securing American Manufacturing of Critical Technologies or Hindering Innovation?
description: A recent determination by the U.S. Department of Energy- drafted ostensibly to promote U.S. competitiveness- may instead stifle innovation by creating bureaucratic delay and uncertainty.

title: Crossing the Line: Transnational Subsidy
description: In the absence of clear WTO norms regulating transnational subsidies, the United States looks to the European Union’s practice to leverage domestic policies to address this concern.

title: Preparing for Deterioration of the Latin America and Caribbean Strategic Environment
description: Senior Associate Evan Ellis discusses the effects of leftist authoritarianism populism, Chinese influence, and Covid-19 as mutually reinforcing factors contributing to the deterioration of the Latin America and Caribbean strategic environment.

title: Russia’s Possible Invasion of Ukraine
description: If peace talks fail, the Russian military has several options to invade Ukraine through northern, central, and southern routes, raising critical questions for the United States and its NATO allies according to analysis by the CSIS International Security Program.

title: Call to Action: Global Coordination to Scale Up Access to Covid-19 Therapies
description: The CSIS Commission on Strengthening America’s Health Security has issued an urgent call to strengthen global coordination related to Covid-19 testing and therapies, including by bolstering R&D, accelerating licensing and production, and supporting equitable access.

title: Safeguarding Critical Minerals for the Energy Transition
description: The United States needs a broader view of the challenges and opportunities involved with critical minerals—and a comprehensive strategy to deal with both.

title: Why is South Korea Hesitant to Boycott the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics?
description: South Korean President Moon Jae-in’s visit to Australia on December 12-15, 2021, revealed a vast discrepancy in Seoul and Canberra’s strategy against the intensifying U.S.-China competition

title: Update on North Korean Human Rights on the First Anniversary of the Biden Inauguration
description: Ambassador Robert King provides an update on the status of North Korean human rights on the first anniversary of President Joe Biden’s inauguration.

title: U.S.-India Insight: 2022: Expected Inflection Points in U.S.-India Ties
description: It is difficult to remember a quiet, calm year in U.S.-India relations. The relationship is replete with areas of congruence and conflict, so inflection points are common. This year will likely be no different.

title: The Mirage of the Metaverse
description: The re-branding of Facebook as “Meta” announced by CEO Mark Zuckerberg on October 28, and the company’s push to develop “an embodied internet that you’re inside of instead of just looking at” has thrown the world into a flurry of metaverse-related activity.

title: The Legacy of Bayh-Dole's Success on U.S. Global Competitiveness Today
description: The Bayh-Dole Act played a key role in renewing American innovation policy in response to the perceived competitiveness challenge from Japan. The lessons of how this legislation came together is once again relevant as we confront today’s innovation challenge from China.
